answers.answer: Hi there.Blackouts can have several causes, from primary neurologic problems to problems with the cardiovascular system or endocrine system.Neurologic problems would include narcolepsy where you feel a sudden and uncontrollable urge to sleep.  Cardiovascular problems would include arteritis (inflammation of the arteries causing narrowing of lumen) which would deprive the brain with oxygen and can cause blackouts.  Low blood hemoglobin through nutritional deficiencies can also cause these problems.In a significant portion of people, blackouts may be the initial manifestation of uncontrolled blood sugar (diabetes).As there are a lot of possibilities, it is best that you have yourself checked by your doctor and have yourself tested for the conditions I mentioned.Regards and God bless.

question: Some one please help me on this, since i was a little girl I have been having these unexplained blackouts in the morning then my sight would pixel black and my head would begin to feel numb. Sometimes i fall and pass out completely. im only 18 i live on my own and i need the best advice out there. I think it's safe to say im freakin out.please if anyone knows what i mean or can help please send me an email at: ***@****.thanks
title: Why do i keep haveing blackouts?
